data.title: Niners to sign Clark Haggans | Page 7
data.text:
Wodwo

Veteran

Posts: 8,476

Originally posted by WRATHman44:

It would make sense to keep him out of practices involving gameplanning if he was refusing to renegotiate. Wouldn't want him to know the defenses and coverages they were emphasizing for the big game. I guess a lot depends on how much faith they have in Dobbs being able to step into a third position (as releasing Haralson would drop us back to 3 OLBs).

...did someone mention a*****e? *sphincter re-puckers*

Yeah, it's pretty strange that his contract is being brought up now. Should have been dealt with a long time ago. We need to have stability right now... next game counts... they need to not dick around.

I just also mentioned dicks.

ImaMod

Veteran

Posts: 10,482

Originally posted by Wodwo:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd be on board if we weren't so thin at the position.

All Haralson does is play well against the run. He can not rush the passer at all

But we are too thin at OLB, youre right

[ Edited by ImaMod on Sep 2, 2012 at 12:20 PM ]

cciowa

Veteran

Posts: 60,541

Originally posted by niners4lyfe:

NO

what did you want the team to do and please give me something better than,, sign an ex niner like travis laboy. the coaches feel he is the best person for what they want and that is someone to come in for spot duty. not hard to figure out. we did try to solve this area in the draft but the two kids got hurt so you go to plan b.

WRATHman44

Staff

Posts: 16,899

Originally posted by Wodwo:

Originally posted by WRATHman44:

It would make sense to keep him out of practices involving gameplanning if he was refusing to renegotiate. Wouldn't want him to know the defenses and coverages they were emphasizing for the big game. I guess a lot depends on how much faith they have in Dobbs being able to step into a third position (as releasing Haralson would drop us back to 3 OLBs).

...did someone mention a*****e? *sphincter re-puckers*

Yeah, it's pretty strange that his contract is being brought up now. Should have been dealt with a long time ago. We need to have stability right now... next game counts... they need to not dick around.

I just also mentioned dicks.

Bold 1: They used the same timing to re-negotiate Ginn's contract last year.

Bold 2:

WRATHman44

Staff

Posts: 16,899

Originally posted by ImaMod:

Originally posted by Wodwo:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd be on board if we weren't so thin at the position.

All Haralson does is play well against the run. He can not rush the passer at all

But we are too thin at OLB, youre right

I actually get pissed at him when he plays the run, too. He gets caught peeking inside on outside runs WAY too often.

SFrush

Veteran

Posts: 5,081

Originally posted by WRATHman44:

I think we are fine. Davis will backup G and T, either directly or indirectly. G goes down, Davis goes in. T goes down, Boone goes to T, Davis to G. Another T goes down, Davis goes to T, Kilgore goes to G. Remember, both Davis and Kilgore will be active on gameday. Additionally, Davis played T for his first few seasons in the league. He's probably not quick enough to be a starter at tackle, but he's good enough as a 3rd stringer.

I think the last time Leonard Davis played tackle was in 05 or 06. I know it's been a while.

btthepunk

Veteran

Posts: 22,704

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

GEEK

Veteran

Posts: 19,200

Good vet signing.

The guy has 3-4 OLB experience, proven track record of production - especially last season, and can provide some insights on the Cardinals D to our team.

Haggins isn't expected to start. So I don't understand why people are hating on this signing.

sfout

Veteran

Posts: 6,442

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

why would you want to cut someone who can play 4 positions? I understand Brock but Dobbs???

WRATHman44

Staff

Posts: 16,899

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

at $2.5 million for Haralson, you could have 5 Brocks or 5 Dobbs for 1 Haralson. If Haralson makes 1-1.5 a year, he looks a lot better.

btthepunk

Veteran

Posts: 22,704

Originally posted by sfout:

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

why would you want to cut someone who can play 4 positions? I understand Brock but Dobbs???

Dobbs played well last preseason but that's all. He's not better at any of those positions than Haralson is at OLB. Quality over quantity.

monsterzero789

Veteran

Posts: 23,812

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

Brock maybe but Dobbs? Hell no

[ Edited by monsterzero789 on Sep 2, 2012 at 12:39 PM ]

AXEGRINDER

Veteran

Posts: 25,671

Originally posted by GEEK:

Good vet signing.

The guy has 3-4 OLB experience, proven track record of production - especially last season, and can provide some insights on the Cardinals D to our team.

Haggins isn't expected to start. So I don't understand why people are hating on this signing.

There's no reason to hate on it, other than possibly who gets cut to make room for him.

sfout

Veteran

Posts: 6,442

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by sfout:

Originally posted by btthepunk:

Originally posted by monsterzero789:

Please please please cut Haralson!!!!

I'd rather cut Dobbs or Brock.

why would you want to cut someone who can play 4 positions? I understand Brock but Dobbs???

Dobbs played well last preseason but that's all. He's not better at any of those positions than Haralson is at OLB. Quality over quantity.

You cant stay that considering you haven't seen Dobbs play in anything but preseason. Coaches dont make players learn 4 positions without planning on keeping them. Besides thats the point Haralson is making $3Mil while Dobbs is making $400K with 4 times the responsibility, that is quality to find a player capable of shouldering such a workload. Haralson is a replaceable over the hill reliable OLB, Dobbs is a young, promising player with potential at 4 positions.
